intro: Scabiosa arvensis var. stricta, commonly known as the upright scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clustered flowers. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and wildflower gardens. Its foliage is typically gray-green with a fuzzy texture, adding visual interest throughout the growing season.
